subject: Real Estate
title: iBuyers: Algorithms That Flip Houses
description: A short lesson to help you apply iBuyers: Algorithms That Flip Houses.

hook.text: In 2014, Opendoor launched a radical idea: an algorithm that buys your house instantly, no showings needed.

buildup.text: Sellers got a cash offer within hours. The company would renovate and resell for a profit.

discovery.text: iBuyers used machine learning to price thousands of homes per day with minimal human input.

twist.text: Zillow tried iBuying too, lost $881 million, and shut the program down in 2021.

climax.text: The lesson: algorithms can estimate, but real estate is still local, emotional, and unpredictable.

punchline.text: Even the best algorithm can't predict a leaky roof.

quiz.question: Why did Zillow shut down its iBuying program?
options: It lost $881 million on bad estimates
